siteMetadata.title: PALPortals

markdownRemark.html:
Solution architecture is a practice of designing, describing, and managing the solution engineering in relation to specific business problems.

Organisations always need creative thinkers who knows what business do and how, in an ever-changing technological landscape.

This is where Solutions Architects come in. They are an integral part of many businesses today, whose input is often the difference between a quick, successful project and a slower roll-out.

How we help to leveling up from "Good" to "Great".

Solutions Architecture is the practice with which we can clearly articulate what work needs to be carried out from the current to future state.

Our experienced Solution Architects can provide you with expert design services and independent advice which will ensure your business stays agile without comprising on security and your desired timeline.

Whether it is a deployment of a single application, public cloud or considering the transition of an enterprise class datacentre to a new location, designing the solution can be a daunting prospect. Today applications and services depend on multiple levels of sophisticated and interdependent technologies. Ensuring the Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability of your data requires Trusted Platforms on which to store and process that information and trusted processes and methods to implement programs of change.

We provide the experience and expertise necessary to help you design and implement Trusted Platforms and guide you to successful implementation.

Our Technical Consultants provide planning, design and integration services across a range of Technology platforms. Whether its planning and designing a secure server infrastructure for a single web application hosted in the Cloud, or developing a new Active Directory and Messaging Infrastructure for a company merger, no job is too complex or too small.

Our team includes Technical Consultants with over fifteen years’ experience in designing, developing and implementing solutions and who hold multiple vendor certifications including:

  • Azure Solutions Architect Professional
  • AWS Solutions Architect Professional
  • VMware Certified Professional (VCP);
  • Microsoft Certified Professional and Systems Engineer (MCP & MCSE); and
  • Cisco Certified Networking Associate (CCNA).

It is our specialist expertise in Information Security however that sets us apart from our competitors. Designing and Implementing a Hybrid Cloud Infrastructure which integrates On-Premise applications with Microsoft Azure and Office 365 is one thing, assuring its security is quite another. We provide the expertise necessary to ensure that you can embrace new technology choices without compromising on security. Our consultants hold specialist certifications in Security Architecture and Cloud security which include:

  • Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP);
  • Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP);
  • Certified Information Systems Security Architecture Professional (CISSP-ISSAP); and
  • CESG Certified Professional (CCP) IA Architect Practitioner

How we measuring the effectiveness of work.

Whilst Solutions Architecture tends to focus mostly on technology, some of the key, non-technical components are often forgotten.

A great technically-orientated architecture may still deliver a bad user experience. This may be because it is unmaintainable or difficult to extend, delivers more than the customer wanted, or not enough of it, simply that it is too costly to build or could be any other barriers.

We have an ability to look beyond technology comes largely with experience in delivering solutions across multiple project types and varied client industries.

In practice, measuring the effectiveness of Solution Architecture can be done by asking the following questions to ensure to get better results:

  • Is the problem clearly stated, and approved by the problem owner?
  • What are the benefits of that architecture, and does it solve the problem stated?
  • Does the proposed architecture fit in the current, or aspired to, business and technology landscape? Is it feasible?
  • Can components of that solution be easily swapped, at low cost, without business interruptions?
  • What is the impact of the solution? Cost vs benefits, training, adoption, technology choice, support requirements, etc…
